90f1c452-a910-477b-a9f0-2f63242c1bc3.description: The earner has achieved a fundamental understanding of a design process that focuses on user needs. The earner can demonstrate techniques to build empathy for users of all abilities.
90f1c452-a910-477b-a9f0-2f63242c1bc3.name: Human Centered Design: Empathizing with Users

badge_template_activities.title: Evaluate designs to determine usability/simplicity, need, uniqueness, and practicality.
Describe the stages of the human-centered design process. Analyze iterations of designed objects and the relationship between iteration and efficacy.
Analyze and discuss the social impact of design. Apply knowledge of how empathy - vs. sympathy - is critical to design process.
Describe the importance of inclusivity in digital design, including designing for people with different abilities.
Examine their own invisible biases to become a self-aware and empathetic designer.

fb9a9b51-4913-4af2-a895-530a3a14b2d5.description: The earner has demonstrated an understanding of the principles and techniques of conducting design interviews. The earner can synthesize information about a design context.
fb9a9b51-4913-4af2-a895-530a3a14b2d5.name: User Interviews: Discovering and Synthesizing User Needs

badge_template_activities.title: Execute interview techniques that establish users' needs and contexts.
Assess users' living environments to identify needs and design opportunities
Document observations and isolate themes from design interviews
Demonstrate techniques for using a variety of data to draw conclusions related to design
Craft an interview plan that demonstrates user research and includes open-ended questions.

5edcfeed-0621-46eb-9bfd-911cb4180b1f.description: The earner has demonstrated an understanding of key aspects of design ideation. The earner can produce and iterate on ideas derived from design research.
5edcfeed-0621-46eb-9bfd-911cb4180b1f.name: Brainstorm: Finding great ideas

badge_template_activities.title: Use professional techniques for group ideation
Employ a systematic process for addressing design challenges
Formulate questions that improve brainstorm efficacy
Narrow a list of ideas down by assessing their feasibility, uniqueness, and alignment to user's needs.

b1a6f52b-07af-47a7-bdc3-00d287539e1b.description: The earner has shown competence in creating, testing and refining several versions of a design, and documenting feedback from real users.
b1a6f52b-07af-47a7-bdc3-00d287539e1b.name: Prototyping: Testing and Evolving Iterations

badge_template_activities.title: Translate ideas into material prototypes using available resources
Use prototypes to iterate, communicate ideas, and consider form and function based on a specific user need
Lead a usability test of an app wireframe, documenting and applying feedback to new versions.
Produce a digital wireframe of an original app idea.

9879868d-ff31-4b7c-963b-3f5acd820b54.description: This earner is an educator who has shared a commitment to implementing the Mouse mission with learners and who can successfully navigate the tools and content on the Mouse Create learning platform.
9879868d-ff31-4b7c-963b-3f5acd820b54.name: Mouse Educator 1: Getting Started on Mouse Create

badge_template_activities.title: Speak to Mouse’s mission of Tech with Purpose and increased diversity in STEM.
Understand the features and content on Mouse Create at a high level.
Create and manage groups on Mouse Create and manage their Mouse Create Group’s Playlist.
Understand breakdown of Courses and their respective badges and skills as well as student & educator accounts on Mouse Create.
Submit work for projects on Mouse Create.

e71439e7-2f22-4f45-89ac-2fdf5850843d.description: The earner has applied best practices in user experience design to plan and test an original app concept. The earner can produce a storyboard, a happy path, and a competitive analysis.
e71439e7-2f22-4f45-89ac-2fdf5850843d.name: User Experience (UX) Design: Planning an App

badge_template_activities.title: Communicate the problem, the solution and the outcome for an app using simple drawings and captions.
Create a UX 3-panel storyboard of an app.
Draw a happy path diagram that communicates the basic steps users will take in an app.
Narrow detailed user flows into a simple sequence of steps.
Identify direct and indirect competitors for an app concept and compare the design of features to identify opportunities to improve.

ab39ed05-b3b3-49b5-9e25-302f6a942a84.description: The earner has applied of the principles and practices of user interface design, including color theory, typography, and visual identity. The earner can mockup and test multiple iterations of a digital app interface using design software.
ab39ed05-b3b3-49b5-9e25-302f6a942a84.name: User Interface (UI) Design: Designing an App

badge_template_activities.title: Apply best practices in color theory and UI to create a color palette for an original app.
Create a style guide that includes colors, typography, layouts, icons and graphical imagery that reflect user research.
Use professional design tools to craft 2 or more iterations of the interface for an original app idea.
Apply a style guide to a mockup.
Lead usability tests to identify key improvements for the following iteration of a design.

f751ac60-6417-4607-a459-d5bfe9f12943.description: The earner is an expert in the principles and practice of design thinking as a tool for student innovation. Earners of this badge are educators who have integrated a project-based design curriculum focused on developing career-relevant human-centered design and UX/UI design skills into a class or informal learning space and facilitated the program successfully with their students.
f751ac60-6417-4607-a459-d5bfe9f12943.name: Design Thinking Educator Micro-Credential: Fostering Student Innovation

badge_template_activities.title: The earner completed a 3-day training on the implementation of the Design League program.
The earner created an implementation plan to integrate the Design League program, curriculum and youth outcomes into their class or student program.
The earner facilitated their adapted design curriculum with a group of students over several weeks and submitted notes on how they would iterate on their implementation in the future.
The earner mentored at least 1 team of student designers to create an original design prototype that addresses a community issue.
The earner created a digital portfolio about their design journey showcasing both their own and their students’ learning about human-centered design in a reflection video.

286b90f2-c6cb-4504-b1d0-b9c2101b9c97.description: Awarded for successfully implementing the computational thinking practice of Algorithms while programming in Scratch. The recipient has demonstrated their grasp of skills and knowledge through project evidence reviewed by Mouse. Mouse supports the capacity of educators to apply a nascent understanding of Scratch programming to create simple programs.
286b90f2-c6cb-4504-b1d0-b9c2101b9c97.name: NanoBadge: Algorithms

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this NanoBadge can demonstrate algorithmic thinking by creating working sequence algorithms in projects.

5b835bf3-7fc6-4bdf-9fe2-55aeda1f2d44.description: Awarded for successfully implementing the computational thinking practices of Looping and Parallelism while programming in Scratch. The recipient has demonstrated their grasp of skills and knowledge through project evidence reviewed by Mouse. Mouse supports the capacity of educators to apply a growing understanding of Scratch programming to design programs with multiple sprites and sounds functioning interdependently.
5b835bf3-7fc6-4bdf-9fe2-55aeda1f2d44.name: NanoBadge: Looping & Parallelism

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this Nanobadge can demonstrate usage of multiple event blocks triggering actions at the same time.

c3552238-e02e-4d98-8a33-bf27ac42e8bf.description: Awarded for successful completion of the Lehman College ESC 537 course. This 50-hour course is part of a LUTE-STEM TQP grant where Mouse.org provides instruction for Clinical Residents. The recipient has gained the technical and pedagogical skills in Computer Science on the Mouse Create online platform to promote their professional learning as an educator.
c3552238-e02e-4d98-8a33-bf27ac42e8bf.name: Creative Computing Microcredential

badge_template_activities.title: The earner demonstrated their ability to create basic programs in Scratch containing multiple sprites while explaining the role of algorithms in Computer Science.
NanoBadge: Algorithms

The earner created a series of programs in Scratch using multiple sprites working in parallel. They have also made connections to this relevance of pattern detection across other school subjects to design a lesson plan using these skills.
NanoBadge: Looping & Parallelism

The earner created multiple Scratch programs using custom blocks, multiple scene changes and broadcasts. They have also detailed the many ways in which the open source community inhibits innovation across multiple industries by designing a lesson plan to emphasize this concept.
NanoBadge: Remixing & Open Source

The earner created programs using advanced features such as augmented reality (AR) and translation tools. They also redesigned a lesson to support an environment of learning that is conducive to student creativity.
NanoBadge: Learning Through Discovery

The earner remixed another Scratch user's game to add features such as enemies, obstacles and score to enhance a the gaming experience. They also designed a capstone lesson that requires a student to create a game in Scratch which utilizes previous learned Computer Science concepts such as algorithms, parallelism, variables, and more.
NanoBadge: Scratch Capstone Creator

d945efd0-edf0-4e33-a8e8-ec1d87d22cbd.description: Awarded for successfully applying open-source practices by remixing Scratch programs from peers and others. The recipient has demonstrated their grasp of skills and knowledge through project evidence reviewed by Mouse. Mouse supports the capacity of educators to apply a growing understanding of Scratch programming to extend projects created by others and demonstrate abstraction when programming in Scratch.
d945efd0-edf0-4e33-a8e8-ec1d87d22cbd.name: NanoBadge: Remixing & Open Source

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this NanoBadge can learn from the creativity of others while designing their own original program.

02dde44d-cb97-4a20-9b98-75abf016a95b.description: Awarded for successfully summarizing the benefits of Creative Computing as it relates to student success. The recipient has demonstrated their grasp of skills and knowledge through project evidence reviewed by Mouse. Mouse supports the capacity of educators to support a student's creativity and curiosity to learn by presenting them with lessons and activities that support this development.
02dde44d-cb97-4a20-9b98-75abf016a95b.name: NanoBadge: Learning Through Discovery

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this NanoBadge can identify and build upon the way in which students learn more using creative computing when compared to memorization and exams.

9641de8e-6dbe-4dfe-821f-1c54cd981a35.description: This earner is an educator who has designed a customized playlist of projects on Mouse Create that aligns to their group’s learning goals and resources. Educators with this credential are approved to evaluate and issue digital badges on behalf of Mouse.
9641de8e-6dbe-4dfe-821f-1c54cd981a35.name: Mouse Educator 2: Teaching Tech with Purpose

badge_template_activities.title: Review submitted projects for satisfactory evidence.
Connect a Mouse Create account to Credly to enable digital badging. Access and navigate the platform and award badges on Mouse Create.
Assess the resources, learning goals and challenges of their site.
Use learning goals to construct a custom playlist of projects on Mouse Create.
Stay connected with the Mouse network.

051ae345-7690-4077-a445-369bd46d0fc3.description: The earner has presented design work in written form and as a presentation, illustrating both final product and the process of design.
051ae345-7690-4077-a445-369bd46d0fc3.name: Pitch & Publish: Presenting a Design

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate learning and mastery of skills showcased in a project
Document design work
Communicate process in technical and non-technical terms
Deliver a compelling pitch of an original design.
Produce a clear and engaging presentation of an original design that includes a user story, a description of need, and a product demonstration.

c3784fa3-e4cf-4baf-b91a-2d571312b982.description: The earner has successfully proven their ability to create a program in Scratch that reflects their interests.
c3784fa3-e4cf-4baf-b91a-2d571312b982.name: Scratch Explorer: Scratch Creative Computing 1

badge_template_activities.title: The earner can save and share Scratch programs.
The earner reflected on Scratch programs they created using a design journal entry.

64557809-c3d3-44dd-aa31-096859b141ed.description: The earner has shown through research how cybersecurity experts manage risk in any industry while applying network analyzing tools to detect insecure data transmission on a computer network.
64557809-c3d3-44dd-aa31-096859b141ed.name: Cybersecurity: Intro to Network Analysis

badge_template_activities.title: The earner differentiated between the types of hackers that exist online
The earner used a professional-level network analyzer to detect attacks on a computer network
The earner explored post-secondary training options to enter a career in cybersecurity

a0664f1c-cf92-4da7-bedc-18c6af394971.description: This earner is able to apply game design concepts to working games in the platform Scratch.
a0664f1c-cf92-4da7-bedc-18c6af394971.name: G4C - Scratch Developer

badge_template_activities.title: Distinguish between different game formats.
Demonstrate their understanding through the use of the platform Scratch.
Reconstruct variables through code to remix an existing game.

f9ea5b01-b021-4b92-95e2-a22ec482b093.description: Awarded for successfully implementing core components of game design into an Impact game made in Scratch. The recipient has demonstrated their grasp of skills and knowledge through project evidence reviewed by Mouse. Mouse supports the growing capacity of educators to create and extend projects that demonstrate a nuanced application of algorithms and abstraction when programming in Scratch.
f9ea5b01-b021-4b92-95e2-a22ec482b093.name: NanoBadge: Scratch Capstone Creator

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this NanoBadge can design a cumulative unit of reflection for students to demonstrate mastery .

6f5cc60b-afe3-4fa9-8d49-1c61a01b6e1d.description: This earner demonstrates a deep understanding of the foundations of gameplay. This individual is highly literate about the working elements of games.
6f5cc60b-afe3-4fa9-8d49-1c61a01b6e1d.name: G4C - Game Designer

badge_template_activities.title: Describe games as working systems and break down core elements using the professional vocabulary of game designers.
Distinguish between the roles of player and designer.
Translate and apply the core elements of games to different game contexts.

54b86949-bf27-475b-86b8-4aceb6762d43.description: This earner understand the potential for games as a vehicle for making an impact on issues in their local and global communities. This designer has demonstrated skills for exploring social consciousness through games in working projects of their own.
54b86949-bf27-475b-86b8-4aceb6762d43.name: G4C - Scratch Activist

badge_template_activities.title: Address social issues or values through game design.
Discuss how different game formats provide opportunities for players to experience issues.
Understand how design features (mechanics, narrative themes, etc.) affect the values or issues content of games.

a3593bb8-a0b2-46ab-aa7e-9859aaa34841.description: The earner has shown competence in testing versions of a design using prototypes, and documenting feedback from real users.
a3593bb8-a0b2-46ab-aa7e-9859aaa34841.name: Iteration: Test and Evolve

badge_template_activities.title: Playtest iterations of designs
Document and apply feedback to new versions of designs

047ac0b8-6488-4202-b134-e1afb1456a02.description: The earner is a designer who empathizes with users of all abilities and sees the potential for assistive technology designs to make a positive impact in the world.
047ac0b8-6488-4202-b134-e1afb1456a02.name: Empathy: User perspectives

badge_template_activities.title: Analyze and discuss the social impact of design
Understand and apply knowledge of how empathy - vs. sympathy - is critical to design process
Experience perspectives, unique abilities, and constraints of end-users
Use simulations to experience different disabilities
Research assistive technology tools & devices

a71f50fd-171c-4f0d-b2e6-551f4be1f839.description: The earner has shown the ability to synthesize various forms of research data and turn what they know into practical devices that guide the design process.
a71f50fd-171c-4f0d-b2e6-551f4be1f839.name: Synthesize: Focusing research

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate techniques for using a variety of data to draw conclusions related to desig
Use professional methods for carrying out design ideas with users at the center

39472092-841d-40d0-afee-bcb8c73d97a9.description: The earner has demonstrated proficiency in circuitry and basic electronics.
39472092-841d-40d0-afee-bcb8c73d97a9.name: Analog Circuits: Basic electronic design

badge_template_activities.title: Describe how electricity flows in a circuit
Understand the relationship between resistance and current
Create working breadboard circuits with LEDs, resistors, sensors, transistors, speakers, potentiometers and buttons
Identify the different pins of the transistor

0c30c4c2-ea25-42b9-bf73-4ab0959f7b37.description: The earner has demonstrated expertise in creating programs in Scratch with audio effects.
0c30c4c2-ea25-42b9-bf73-4ab0959f7b37.name: Scratch Animator: Scratch Creative Computing 2

badge_template_activities.title: The earner designed and animated their own sprites.
The earner incorporated sound and music blocks into a Scratch program.

a2fc61f0-d6f4-4b36-9ae1-8997eea92760.description: The earner has demonstrated an understanding of HTML and CSS syntax by writing and remixing common tags and properties in both languages.
a2fc61f0-d6f4-4b36-9ae1-8997eea92760.name: HTML & CSS: Code for the web

badge_template_activities.title: Recognize, write and edit introductory HTML and CSS code
Use HTML tags to embed images, create links, and format text & layout
Edit CSS styles to change the look and feel of a web page
Identify and resolve syntax errors

878c2595-085f-44af-8ed3-e746392ffdc0.description: The earner of this badge exhibits an understanding of 3-dimensional modelling in both analog and CAD software settings.
878c2595-085f-44af-8ed3-e746392ffdc0.name: 3D Design: 3-dimensional modelling

badge_template_activities.title: Name and define the basic components of 3D shapes.
Represent 3-dimensional shapes in 2D.
Perform basic functions in 3D CAD software.
Apply knowledge of basic CAD software techniques to real-world design.
Use real-life reference objects to recreate an object in CAD software.

6678d163-f445-4dde-a7a4-647fd4c38e1b.description: This earner is an educator who has completed the G4C Educator Handbook project on Mouse Create as a part of the Games 4 Change Student Challenge. This educator has designed a customized playlist of projects on Mouse Create that provides their students with the tools they need to enter a project into the G4C Student Challenge. Educators with this credential are approved to evaluate and issue digital badges on behalf of Mouse.
6678d163-f445-4dde-a7a4-647fd4c38e1b.name: G4C Educator Badge

Assess the resources, learning goals and challenges of their site.
Use learning goals to construct a custom playlist of projects on Mouse Create.
Stay connected with the Mouse network.

bdcbc806-32c9-4b4c-82f1-86e302419e8d.description: The earner of this badge has completed work demonstrating mastery in basic visual communication methods.
bdcbc806-32c9-4b4c-82f1-86e302419e8d.name: Graphic Design: Design for 2 dimensions

badge_template_activities.title: Name basic elements of graphic design and describe best practices for laying out 2D designs.
Use a color wheel to produce color schemes and connect colors to the moods and feelings of people.
Use color to improve usability for people with visual impairments.
List and define the elements of typography and identify reasons typography is important to design.

441c629e-9104-4233-a5fa-c974600a612a.description: The earner has demonstrated an understanding of how data travels to and from the internet. The earner understands the devices and topology of local area networks.
441c629e-9104-4233-a5fa-c974600a612a.name: Networks: How data travels

badge_template_activities.title: Describe the function of routers and switches in a network.
Use ping and traceroute utilities to troubleshoot network connection.
Design a network connecting a defined set of devices into a working topology.
Describe the relationship between IP & MAC addresses, TCP/IP, DNS.
Explain how internet browsers communicate with and display a website.

fdd89bbf-d08e-4d73-8443-22db577c66e5.description: The earner of this badge has explored the issues of policy, choice, and research on the web.
fdd89bbf-d08e-4d73-8443-22db577c66e5.name: Web Citizen: Savvy internet use

badge_template_activities.title: Describe how ads work in relation to websites and name ways to add privacy between users and ad companies.
Describe what “copyright” means. Contrast with the main goal behind the Open Web Movement and describe various types of Creative Commons licences.
Assess the truthfulness of information found online and identify the potential bias of certain websites.

Create code using if/else structures (conditional statements) and variables

badge_template_activities.title: Research, plan and document an original invention

Demonstrate effective strategies for communicating with teammates.

The earner created a “How-To” guide for hosting “Future Forward” Career Panels.

badge_template_activities.title: Identify and incorporate patterns or interactions from nature into an original design.
Recognize and define basic prototyping & circuitry language.
Utilize mechanical and electronic building materials, tools & techniques.
Program an animatronic circuit with an Arduino and servo motor.
Document a design process.

39d78d79-496e-49cb-8953-2554b3ebd8c8.description: This earner is able to design and build a digital circuit and mechanical prototype around the theme of 'future humans' incorporating elements inspired by nature.
39d78d79-496e-49cb-8953-2554b3ebd8c8.name: Future Humans: Invention inspired by nature

badge_template_activities.title: Identify and incorporate patterns or interactions from nature into an original design.
Recognize and define basic prototyping & circuitry language.
Utilize mechanical and electronic building materials, tools & techniques.
Program a bionic circuit with an Arduino and servo motor.
Document a design process.

392212f3-f04b-4c2d-b19b-cf21cf4ba5e1.description: The earner has demonstrated a deep understanding of the foundations of gameplay. This individual is highly literate about the working elements of games.
392212f3-f04b-4c2d-b19b-cf21cf4ba5e1.name: Game Designer: Components of play

badge_template_activities.title: Describe games as working systems and break down core elements using the professional vocabulary of game designers.
Distinguish between the roles of player and designer.
Translate and apply the core elements of games to different game contexts.

d8b460a6-7451-4613-85b3-c4e1dd4d9d13.description: The earner has implemented bash commands and created scripts to navigate file directories in a new way, unlocking new opportunities for manipulating computing systems.
d8b460a6-7451-4613-85b3-c4e1dd4d9d13.name: I.T. Support: Intro to IT Automation

badge_template_activities.title: The earner made use of more than ten Command Line commands to automate a process using a bash script
The earner used their knowledge of shell scripting to explore opportunities in the field of Information Technology

74dd1fd5-d521-4268-ac9f-5320165dce77.description: The earner of this badge is able to design, curate, and document project work for digital learning portfolios.
74dd1fd5-d521-4268-ac9f-5320165dce77.name: Portfolio Craft: Building Digital Portfolios

badge_template_activities.title: Create and utilize project documents to demonstrate desirable qualities to schools and jobs; curate work based on portfolio goals and audience.
Design project rubrics.
Use constructive criticism and feedback.
Create a portfolio template which can be continuously updates.
Conduct user testing to assess digital portfolios and other websites.

f385ba21-483e-4f02-b4a8-d0cabcf15d0e.description: The earner has demonstrated mastery of basic programming processes and applications.
f385ba21-483e-4f02-b4a8-d0cabcf15d0e.name: Programming: Talking to computers

badge_template_activities.title: Identify and describe programming languages
Write simple code in different languages
Break down a simple process into multiple steps
Use basic commands in the command line interface

da50b81c-c4d8-4c0f-8e31-da39e941516f.description: The earner has demonstrated expertise in earth-friendly energy sources. Earners of this badge know the importance of using renewables and reducing energy consumption for the future of our planet.
da50b81c-c4d8-4c0f-8e31-da39e941516f.name: Renewable Energy: Fossil fuel alternatives

badge_template_activities.title: Name alternative energy sources and describe their advantages
Identify habit changes that can help lessen effects of global climate change
Describe the importance of reducing electricity use
Describe how batteries work and why battery technology needs to improve
Describe the process by which solar panels convert sunlight into electricity

f945205f-d4d5-4e61-abad-69259694edd8.description: The earner has proven their ability to design a Scratch program to test another’s ability to code in Scratch.
f945205f-d4d5-4e61-abad-69259694edd8.name: Scratch Advanced Concepts: Scratch Creative Computing 4

badge_template_activities.title: The earner designed a program to be bugged and provided directions to solve it.
The earner made use of the cloning feature in Scratch.

6c478557-1abc-4aac-9a44-d79c0921fd08.description: The earner has proven their ability to collaborate with others to create a Scratch program with multiple scenes.
6c478557-1abc-4aac-9a44-d79c0921fd08.name: Scratch Storyteller: Scratch Creative Computing 3

badge_template_activities.title: The earner made their own blocks to demonstrate their knowledge of programming functions.
The earner created interactions between two AIs using broadcast and receive blocks in Scratch.

1d8e5ddf-c75a-4e62-8dfb-88ccb84362fb.description: The earner of this badge is able to design and create analog circuits with sewable electronics and fabric.
1d8e5ddf-c75a-4e62-8dfb-88ccb84362fb.name: Sewing Circuits: Conducting Currents with Needle & Thread

badge_template_activities.title: Recognize and define basic sewing vocabulary; utilize basic stitching techniques such as a running stitch to compile fabric pieces and create circuits and add buttons and button closures to secure components to fabric.
Create and utilize sewing patterns to trace and assemble project pieces in the correct size and order.
Identify and describe the role of circuit components using engineering vocabulary and demonstrate how electricity flows in a circuit.
Embed a circuit in fabric.
Make a switch for circuits using sewable snaps.

67d5bbdc-df5a-4dd5-9cdb-820a4f6d6dba.description: This earner has successfully launched a video for online sharing. The earner has proven their ability to shoot, edit, share and promote using careful strategies common to producers of scripted viral media.
67d5bbdc-df5a-4dd5-9cdb-820a4f6d6dba.name: Viral Media: Creating shareable videos online

badge_template_activities.title: Compare historical and contemporary documentary filmmaking techniques.
Assess a style of filming to best visualize their story.
Use a film editing software to create a video with multiple clips, audio and graphics.
Promote and share their video online and offline through proven strategies for success.

20aa0801-c1a7-4f43-8969-3cf8a3ffa3db.description: The earner has demonstrated broad expertise in all things software. The earner knows desktop programs, creates collaboratively with others using web-based apps, and has designed and built a simple mobile app.
20aa0801-c1a7-4f43-8969-3cf8a3ffa3db.name: Apps & Software: Programs for all devices

badge_template_activities.title: Install & uninstall programs, and identify program files by extensions
Analyze & compare apps, and create & share using web-based collaboration apps
Identify a need and translate it into a prototype of an original mobile app
Code an Android app using App Inventor 2
Use an emulator to test an app

e08f3c95-1428-454a-9ee4-80e9ddba20d0.description: Mouse is currently developing badges for this course. We will add the badges here when they are ready. You are welcome to get started on the course before the badges are done.
e08f3c95-1428-454a-9ee4-80e9ddba20d0.name: Badge TBD!

c4440d3b-ad55-44f6-9c58-c3e217876a0f.description: This earner is able to use microcontrollers to program and control circuits made with sewable materials.
c4440d3b-ad55-44f6-9c58-c3e217876a0f.name: Coding Gemma: Programming Sewable Circuits with Microcontrollers

badge_template_activities.title: Set up a sewable microcontroller to receive code from a computer and connect external components to a sewable microcontroller so that they can receive code and respond accordingly.
Create basic code for a sewable microcontroller using Python programming language.
Incorporate a sewable microcontroller into a programmable circuit with conductive fabric materials.
Utilize the sewable microcontroller and Python programming language to program a device that can track goals.
Use a goal tracker to set, work towards, and achieve daily goals.

afc52f00-4d0f-4730-976c-2bcaba4b2c41.description: The earner of this badge is able to use microcontrollers to program and control circuits made with sewable materials.
afc52f00-4d0f-4730-976c-2bcaba4b2c41.name: Coding LilyPad: Programming Sewable Circuits with Microcontrollers

badge_template_activities.title: Set up a sewable microcontroller to receive code from an IDE and connect external components to a sewable microcontroller so that they can receive code and respond accordingly.
Create basic code for a sewable microcontroller using Arduino programming language.
Incorporate a sewable microcontroller into a programmable circuit with conductive fabric materials.
Utilize the sewable microcontroller and Arduino programming language to program a device that can track goals.
Use a goal tracker to set, work towards, and achieve daily goals.

e0861fa0-c6aa-4e03-86be-8536b0f66dd7.description: The earner has shown their expertise in identifying components of a computer network and how they are interconnected. They have also designed and tested networks in a virtual setting.
e0861fa0-c6aa-4e03-86be-8536b0f66dd7.name: Computer Networking: Intro to Network Topologies

badge_template_activities.title: The earner identified device location by gaining an understanding of IP Addressing
The earner used a professional networking tool to build and configure several types of computer networks
The earner used agile processes designed for the workplace to collaborate with their peers on a technical project

skills.name: Building Career Development Programs and Succession Planning

d8c6b017-857a-4c8a-8e9c-2c41cd4f63a1.description: The earner has demonstrated the skills and dispositions to help people with tech problems with the confidence to be hands-on.
d8c6b017-857a-4c8a-8e9c-2c41cd4f63a1.name: Fixer: Hands-on problem solving

badge_template_activities.title: Disassemble a working machine and identify part functions
Use appropriate questions to find out information from users
Document problems, track ongoing support & describe solutions using a ticket tracking system
Create and manage a project timeline & deliverables
Develop, prototype and distribute a teaching tool using a mix of media

763acbf5-d584-4cac-b838-2cf76d1b9319.description: The earner has demonstrated an understanding of electricity production, the role fossil fuels play in that process, and why those fuels pose problems for our environment.
763acbf5-d584-4cac-b838-2cf76d1b9319.name: Making Electricity: Energy and where it comes from

badge_template_activities.title: Describe the process that turns fossil fuels into electricity
List reasons why fossil fuels are problematic
Build simple, hand-held electrcicity generators
Explain the role of turbines in power generation and build model turbines

a277bc08-1b69-46d9-8476-557f12c1429f.description: The earner has demonstrated competency in computer science foundations, going deeper into operating system mechanics and applications.
a277bc08-1b69-46d9-8476-557f12c1429f.name: Operating Systems: UI Controls

badge_template_activities.title: Define the technical term Operating System
Configure devices using the operating system's settings
Explore popular operating systems including open-source & proprietary software
Analyze why we use different input & output methods for different technology tasks
Explain the pros & cons of various methods of human computer interaction

cb52c364-1c21-468d-b49b-083759360001.description: The earner of this badge is able to use web design and user experience skills in the design of digital portfolios that are well organized, attractive, and easy to navigate.
cb52c364-1c21-468d-b49b-083759360001.name: Portfolio Style: Designing Digital Portfolios

badge_template_activities.title: Identify achievements to include in a digital learning portfolio along with the audiences for a learning portfolio.
Create wireframes of web pages, utilizing UX/UI best practices to design digital learning portfolios.
Design organizing schemes and create corresponding file structures.
Use collaborative software to create and manage digital files.

cf5f0058-7af0-4244-b9f4-e9562f217afb.description: The earner can find solutions to a community's energy challenges, educate others about reducing carbon footprint, and empower change that lessens the negative impacts of technology on our climate.
cf5f0058-7af0-4244-b9f4-e9562f217afb.name: Powering Change: Green energy solutions

badge_template_activities.title: Measure the electricity used by common technologies
Synthesize energy data, and describe how electricity usage impacts our climate.
Design and manage a media campaign to educate others, using data from experiments to defend ideas.
Design and demonstrate clear, confident and persuasive presentations to convince others to adopt energy-saving ideas.

b7564c1c-2c1a-4ffb-88c5-15252615f9e9.description: The earner of this badge is able to build and program digital circuits with a Raspberry Pi.
b7564c1c-2c1a-4ffb-88c5-15252615f9e9.name: Raspberry Pi Circuits: Microcontroller Programming

badge_template_activities.title: Wire a  Raspberry Pi into a breadboard circuit.
Work with variables, delays, digital pins, and loop, commands in the Python programming language.
Create code using if/else structures (conditional statements) and variables.
Describe the difference between Binary and Analog signals.

09c3a573-8648-409b-aabd-bb2bf0840865.description: The earner is a game designer who understands the potential for games as a vehicle for exploring serious issues in the local and global communities. This designer has demonstrated skills for exploring social consciousness through games in working projects of their own.
09c3a573-8648-409b-aabd-bb2bf0840865.name: Scratch Activist: Games for social change

badge_template_activities.title: Address social issues or values through game design
Discuss how different game formats provide opportunities for players to experience issues
Understand how design features (mechanics, narrative themes, etc.) affect the values or issues content of games

2156f7b4-c0b9-41dc-96b5-f702178c7d84.description: The earner has ideated, designed, and created their own Scratch game to address an issue in the world.
2156f7b4-c0b9-41dc-96b5-f702178c7d84.name: Scratch Creative Game Making: Scratch Creative Computing 5

badge_template_activities.title: The earner can create and incorporate variables into a Scratch program.
The earner can remix another Scratch user's program to learn from their code.
The earner can design a game in Scratch that can be won or lost by a Scratch user.

2aac136a-78b0-451a-8006-c497187e8ded.description: the earner of this badge is able to control the flow of electric current in a sewable circuit using a variety of switches.
2aac136a-78b0-451a-8006-c497187e8ded.name: Sewing Switches: Controlling the Current in Sewable Circuits

badge_template_activities.title: Create circuits that include switches and sensors.
Design switches for circuits using sewable conductive elements to make buttons, sensors and snaps.
Describe the roles switches and sensors play in circuits.
Observe changes to resistance and explain the effect it has on a circuit's load.
